body_html:
It seems it's hard either way -- if you include ties, you may end up with a larger than wanted set, if you exclude them, you may end up with a smaller than wanted set. If you want to enforce a constant size, you have to pick from the set of ties.

The logic for this would be comparatively complicated, since I assume you'd definitely want to include ties if the set of tied values fits in k (i.e. for top 5, if places 1 and 2 are tied, you still want them in the set).

I think an extra argument handle_ties with possible values include, exclude, or sample (the default being sample) would make sense.

The logic for this would be comparatively complicated, since I assume you'd definitely want to include ties if the set of tied values fits in k (i.e. for top 5, if places 1 and 2 are tied, you still want them in the set).
